32138e56-43b1-49ea-8533-ba321f0d9816.description: Earners engaged in a joint Cities of Learning and Patcham High School Career Explorer week, by attending a Zoom webinar to develop their understanding and think creatively about the opportunities presented by college and apprenticeships to support their future career choices. Earners gained an increased understanding of what colleges are looking for, what research they could be doing, with opportunities to ask questions of the panel, developing their webinar protocol and communication skills

bbdd2568-cb8e-47d2-b49e-6d81d763b48b.description: Earners of this badge have independently conducted a research project issued from Patcham High School, developing their transferable skills and resilience in self-study. This badge shows the individual was successful in developing their research skills, demonstrating whilst studying remotely. The earner has compiled a comprehensive research project, over five days, produced in a vlog, slide presentation or document, which was presented, with follow up questions answered.
bbdd2568-cb8e-47d2-b49e-6d81d763b48b.name: Patcham High School Independent Researcher

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badge Standard- Participate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participate Layer of the Cities of Learning Badge Standard. Earners meet expectations, can interact with learning and are able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner developed an understanding of an independent research project, building their investigative skills through self-motivated studyDetail the event the person participated in an event on coding.
The earner has compiled a comprehensive research project that included primary and secondary research using analytical and summarising skills to identify and conclude the project piece.
The earner visually presented their research via a vlog, Google slide presentation or word document and responded to questions following the presentation.
Patcham High School, Ladies Mile Rd, Patcham, Brighton BN1 8PB
This badge is open for Patcham High School students

6686e895-d7b4-4dcf-a4dd-c59239312c16.description: Earners of this badge have engaged in an independently conducted research project issued from Patcham High School, that enabled the individual to develop knowledge of transferable skills and resilience in self study. This badge shows the individual has experienced and understood how to develop their research skills whilst studying remotely. The earner has participated in compiling a project, over five hours, producing their research either in a vlog, slide presentation or word document.

Patcham High School, Ladies' Mile Rd, Patcham, Brighton BN1 8PB

7754a05e-9e0c-4f9a-b0ac-76bee4aaae67.description: Earners have demonstrated their research skills through successfully completing an independent research project issued from Patcham High School, establishing in a real-world setting, their transferable skills and resilience in self-study. alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badge Standard - Demonstrate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Badge Standard. Earners show consistency in their approach and can apply knowledge with real world context to receive feedback and develop.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner demonstrated an understanding of independent research, building their investigative skills through self-motivated study

The earner has compiled a comprehensive research project over 5 days, that included primary and secondary research, summarising information from different spoken and written sources to identify and conclude the project piece

The earner has demonstrated an excellent understanding of the subject gained through a thorough critical analysis producing their research either in a vlog, Google slide presentation or word document.
Earners shared their research with an authoritative figure linked to their chosen topic, to receive feedback and guidance to inform next steps.
Patcham High School, Ladies' Mile Road, Patcham, Brighton BN1 8PB
This badge is open for Patcham High School students
